name: _cheesekayke
text: What's interesting is, Chris tried to make dramatic tension by making us wonder if Todd would die when Todd had been in all of 3 strips. I mean, he was my favorite character at that time, but still, normally people wait until you care about the characters before pulling something like that.

name: em2
text: Achewood has always been about taking chances and pushing the envelope, of course.

name: jordstar
text:
I think this strip is the surreptitious introduction of Blister. We don't see him, but we hear him talking. I'm sure it's not Todd talking like Blister. I have two theories.

1. Blister was in the van with Todd, and died in the accident. That's why Todd's so surprised to see him when Blister presents himself to Todd later.

2. Blister was already dead and watching out for Todd, kinda like a guardian angel. He speaks since Todd's all messed up and unconscious. But he loses consciousness and Todd regains it in time to say he can't feel his tail. Afterward (and in the next strip) Todd either doesn't yet notice Blister is dead, or doesn't really care since squirrels come back. (Or at least Todd does.)
